00037     /*
00038      Sent when the application is about to move from active to inactive state. This can occur for certain types of temporary interruptions (such as an incoming phone call or SMS message) or when the user quits the application and it begins the transition to the background state.
00039      Use this method to pause ongoing tasks, disable timers, and throttle down OpenGL ES frame rates. Games should use this method to pause the game.
00040      */

00045     /*
00046      Use this method to release shared resources, save user data, invalidate timers, and store enough application state information to restore your application to its current state in case it is terminated later. 
00047      If your application supports background execution, called instead of applicationWillTerminate: when the user quits.

00067 /**
00068  applicationWillTerminate: saves changes in the application's managed object context before the application terminates.
00069  */
00070 - (void)applicationWillTerminate:(UIApplication *)application {
00071     [self saveContext];
00072 }

00075 - (void)saveContext {
00076     
00077     NSError *error = nil;
00078         NSManagedObjectContext *managedObjectContext = self.managedObjectContext;
00079     if (managedObjectContext != nil) {
00080         if ([managedObjectContext hasChanges] && ![managedObjectContext save:&error]) {
00081             /*
00082              Replace this implementation with code to handle the error appropriately.
00083              
00084              abort() causes the application to generate a crash log and terminate. You should not use this function in a shipping application, although it may be useful during development. If it is not possible to recover from the error, display an alert panel that instructs the user to quit the application by pressing the Home button.
00085              */
00086             NSLog(@"Unresolved error %@, %@", error, [error userInfo]);
00087             abort();
00088         } 
00089     }
00090 }

00093 #pragma mark -
00094 #pragma mark Core Data stack
00095 
00096 /**
00097  Returns the managed object context for the application.
00098  If the context doesn't already exist, it is created and bound to the persistent store coordinator for the application.
00099  */
00100 - (NSManagedObjectContext *)managedObjectContext {
00101     
00102     if (managedObjectContext_ != nil) {
00103         return managedObjectContext_;
00104     }
00105     
00106     NSPersistentStoreCoordinator *coordinator = [self persistentStoreCoordinator];
00107     if (coordinator != nil) {
00108         managedObjectContext_ = [[NSManagedObjectContext alloc] init];
00109         [managedObjectContext_ setPersistentStoreCoordinator:coordinator];
00110     }
00111     return managedObjectContext_;
00112 }
00113 
00114 
00115 /**
00116  Returns the managed object model for the application.
00117  If the model doesn't already exist, it is created from the application's model.
00118  */
00119 - (NSManagedObjectModel *)managedObjectModel {
00120     
00121     if (managedObjectModel_ != nil) {
00122         return managedObjectModel_;
00123     }
00124     NSURL *modelURL = [[NSBundle mainBundle] URLForResource:@"Handla" withExtension:@"momd"];
00125     managedObjectModel_ = [[NSManagedObjectModel alloc] initWithContentsOfURL:modelURL];    
00126     return managedObjectModel_;
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 /**
00131  Returns the persistent store coordinator for the application.
00132  If the coordinator doesn't already exist, it is created and the application's store added to it.
00133  */
00134 - (NSPersistentStoreCoordinator *)persistentStoreCoordinator {
00135     
00136     if (persistentStoreCoordinator_ != nil) {
00137         return persistentStoreCoordinator_;
00138     }
00139     
00140     NSURL *storeURL = [[self applicationDocumentsDirectory] URLByAppendingPathComponent:@"Handla.sqlite"];
00141     
00142     NSError *error = nil;
00143     persistentStoreCoordinator_ = [[NSPersistentStoreCoordinator alloc] initWithManagedObjectModel:[self managedObjectModel]];
00144     if (![persistentStoreCoordinator_ addPersistentStoreWithType:NSSQLiteStoreType configuration:nil URL:storeURL options:nil error:&error]) {
00145         /*
00146          Replace this implementation with code to handle the error appropriately.
00147          
00148          abort() causes the application to generate a crash log and terminate. You should not use this function in a shipping application, although it may be useful during development. If it is not possible to recover from the error, display an alert panel that instructs the user to quit the application by pressing the Home button.
00149          
00150          Typical reasons for an error here include:
00151          * The persistent store is not accessible;
00152          * The schema for the persistent store is incompatible with current managed object model.
00153          Check the error message to determine what the actual problem was.
00154          
00155          
00156          If the persistent store is not accessible, there is typically something wrong with the file path. Often, a file URL is pointing into the application's resources directory instead of a writeable directory.
00157          
00158          If you encounter schema incompatibility errors during development, you can reduce their frequency by:
00159          * Simply deleting the existing store:
00160          [[NSFileManager defaultManager] removeItemAtURL:storeURL error:nil]
00161          
00162          * Performing automatic lightweight migration by passing the following dictionary as the options parameter: 
00163          [NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSNumber numberWithBool:YES],NSMigratePersistentStoresAutomaticallyOption, [NSNumber numberWithBool:YES], NSInferMappingModelAutomaticallyOption, nil];
00164          
00165          Lightweight migration will only work for a limited set of schema changes; consult "Core Data Model Versioning and Data Migration Programming Guide" for details.
00166          
00167          */
00168         NSLog(@"Unresolved error %@, %@", error, [error userInfo]);
00169         abort();
00170     }    
00171     
00172     return persistentStoreCoordinator_;
00173 }

00179 /**
00180  Returns the URL to the application's Documents directory.
00181  */
00182 - (NSURL *)applicationDocumentsDirectory {
00183     return [[[NSFileManager defaultManager] URLsForDirectory:NSDocumentDirectory inDomains:NSUserDomainMask] lastObject];
00184 }
